definitions.definition: a thick, solid piece that has been cut or broken off something

examples.text: He cut the food up into bite-size chunks.
I bought the cheese in one big chunk.
Chunks of masonry lay in the grass around the ruined building.

definitions.definition: a fairly large amount of something

examples.text: I've already written a fair chunk of the article.
This one project has taken a substantial chunk of our budget.

definitions.definition: a phrase or group of words that can be learnt as a unit by somebody who is learning a language. Examples of chunks are ‘Can I have the bill, please?’ and ‘Pleased to meet you’.

examples.text: The listening texts consist of short, bite-sized chunks which are accessible to beginners.

wordOrigin: late 17th cent.: apparently an alteration of the noun chuck senses (1) and (3).
